Orbit

Orbit is an easy, powerful, responsive image slider that allows users to swipe on touch-enabled devices.

  • Caption One.
  • Caption Two.
  • Caption Three.

How to Setup Orbit

Orbit requires minimal HTML markup to function. Our JavaScript takes care of most of the heavy lifting for you. The only thing you need to do is add a <ul data-orbit></ul> element to your page. You can then populate it with images, text, and captions. Here's the markup required to implement a basic Orbit slider on your page:

HTML

<ul class="example-orbit" data-orbit>
  <li>
    <img src="../assets/img/examples/satelite-orbit.jpg" alt="slide 1" />
    <div class="orbit-caption">
      Caption One.
    </div>
  </li>
  <li>
    <img src="../assets/img/examples/andromeda-orbit.jpg" alt="slide 2" />
    <div class="orbit-caption">
      Caption Two.
    </div>
  </li>
  <li>
    <img src="../assets/img/examples/launch-orbit.jpg" alt="slide 3" />
    <div class="orbit-caption">
      Caption Three.
    </div>
  </li>
</ul>

Rendered HTML

<div class="orbit-container">
  <ul data-orbit class="example-orbit orbit-slides-container">
    <li>
      <img src="http://placehold.it/1000x300/A92B48/fff" alt="slide 1" />
      <div class="orbit-caption">
        Caption One.
      </div>
    </li>
    <li class="active">
      <img src="http://placehold.it/1000x300/EE964D/fff" alt="slide 2" />
      <div class="orbit-caption">
        Caption Two.
      </div>
    </li>
    <li>
      <img src="http://placehold.it/1000x300/FDC43D/fff" alt="slide 3" />
      <div class="orbit-caption">
        Caption Three.
      </div>
    </li>
  </ul>

  <!-- Navigation Arrows -->
  <a href="#" class="orbit-prev">Prev <span></span></a>
  <a href="#" class="orbit-next">Next <span></span></a>

  <!-- Slide Numbers -->
  <div class="orbit-slide-number">
    <span>1</span> of <span>3</span>
  </div>

  <!-- Timer and Play/Pause Button -->
  <div class="orbit-timer">
    <span></span>
    <div class="orbit-progress"></div>
  </div>
</div>

<!-- Bullets -->
<ol class="orbit-bullets">
  <li data-orbit-slide-number="1"></li>
  <li data-orbit-slide-number="2" class="active"></li>
  <li data-orbit-slide-number="3"></li>
</ol>

Content Sliders

Orbit can also be used with just content and no images.

HTML

<ul class="example-orbit-content" data-orbit>
  <li data-orbit-slide="headline-1">
    <div>
      <h2>Headline 1</h2>
      <h3>Subheadline</h3>
    </div>
  </li>
  <li data-orbit-slide="headline-2">
    <div>
      <h2>Headline 2</h2>
      <h3>Subheadline</h3>
    </div>
  </li>
  <li data-orbit-slide="headline-3">
    <div>
      <h2>Headline 3</h2>
      <h3>Subheadline</h3>
    </div>
  </li>
</ul>

Rendered HTML

  • Headline 1

    Subheadline

  • Headline 2

    Subheadline

  • Headline 3

    Subheadline

Deep Linking

To link to a particular slide in your Orbit slider you will need to add a data-orbit-slide attribute to each slide. Then anywhere on your page you can use data-orbit-link to link to that slide.

HTML

<a data-orbit-link="headline-1" class="small button">
  Goto Slide 1
</a>
<a data-orbit-link="headline-2" class="small button">
  Goto Slide 2
</a>
<a data-orbit-link="headline-3" class="small button">
  Goto Slide 3
</a>

Rendered HTML

Goto Slide 1 Goto Slide 2 Goto Slide 3

  • Headline 1

    Subheadline

  • Headline 2

    Subheadline

  • Headline 3

    Subheadline

Customize With Sass

We've included a bunch of variables that you'll be able to use if you're into getting SASSy with things.

$include-html-orbit-classes: $include-html-classes;

// We use these to control the caption styles
$orbit-container-bg: #f5f5f5;
$orbit-caption-bg: rgba(0,0,0,0.6);
$orbit-caption-font-color: #fff;
$orbit-caption-font-size: emCalc(14);
$orbit-caption-position: "bottom";    // Supported values: "bottom", "under"
$orbit-caption-padding: emCalc(10,14);
$orbit-caption-height: auto;

// We use these to control the left/right nav styles
$orbit-nav-bg: rgba(0,0,0,0.6);
$orbit-nav-bg-hover: rgba(0,0,0,0.6);
$orbit-nav-arrow-color: #fff;
$orbit-nav-arrow-color-hover: #ccc;

// We use these to control the timer styles
$orbit-timer-bg: rgba(0,0,0,0.6);
$orbit-timer-show-progress-bar: true;

// We use these to control the bullet nav styles
$orbit-bullet-nav-color: #999;
$orbit-bullet-nav-color-active: #222;
$orbit-bullet-radius: emCalc(18);

// We use these to controls the style of slide numbers
$orbit-slide-number-bg: rgba(0,0,0,0);
$orbit-slide-number-font-color: #fff;
$orbit-slide-number-padding: rem-calc(5px);

// Graceful Loading Wrapper and preloader
$wrapper-class: "slideshow-wrapper";
$preloader-class: "preloader";

Configuring Orbit

Here is Orbit in its most basic configuration. You can choose to either initialize with JavaScript or use data-attributes, which are explained below.

JS

$(document).foundation('orbit', {
  animation_speed: 1500
});

HTML

<ul data-orbit data-options="animation_speed:1500;">
  ...
</ul>

 

Code Example

Description


$(document).foundation('orbit', {
Initialization
Initializes orbit
  animation: 'fade',
animation
Sets the type of animation used for transitioning between slides. Default: fade
  timer_speed: 10000,
timer_speed
Sets the amount of time in milliseconds before transitioning a slide. Default: 10000
  pause_on_hover: true,
pause_on_hover
Pauses on the current slide while hovering. Default: true
  resume_on_mouseout: false,
resume_on_mouseout
If pause on hover is set to true, this setting resumes playback after mousing out of slide. Default: false
  animation_speed: 500,
animation_speed
Sets the amount of time in milliseconds the transition between slides will last. Default: 500
  stack_on_small: true,
stack_on_small
Default: true
  navigation_arrows: true,
navigation_arrows
Default: true
  slide_number: true,
slide_number
Default: true
  container_class: 'orbit-container',
container_class
Default: orbit-container
  container_class: 'stack_on_small_class',
stack_on_small_class
Default: 'orbit-stack-on-small'
  next_class: 'orbit-next',
next_class
Class name given to the next button. Default: 'orbit-stack-on-small'
  prev_class: 'orbit-prev',
prev_class
Class name given to the previous button. Default: 'orbit-prev'
  timer_container_class: 'orbit-timer',
timer_container
Class name given to the timer. Default: 'orbit_timer'
  timer_paused_class: 'paused',
timer_paused_class
Class name given to the paused button. Default: 'paused'
  timer_progress_class: 'orbit-progress',
timer_progress_class
Class name given to the progress bar. Default: 'orbit-progress'
  slides_container_class: 'orbit-slides-container',
slides_container_class
Class name given to the slides container. Default: 'orbit-stack-on-small'
  bullets_container_class: 'orbit-bullets',
bullets_container_class
Default: 'orbit-bullets'
  bullets_active_class: 'active',
bullets_active_class
Class name given to the active bullet. Default: 'active'
  slide_number_class: 'orbit-slide-number',
slide_number_class
Class name given to the slide number. Default: 'orbit-slide_number'
  caption_class: 'orbit-caption',
caption_class
Class name given to the caption. Default: 'orbit-caption'
  active_slide_class: 'active',
active_slide_class
Class name given to the active slide. Default: 'active'
  orbit_transition_class: 'orbit-transitioning',
orbit_transition_class
Class name given to ?? Default: 'orbit-transitioning'
  bullets: true,
bullets
Does the slider have bullets visible? Default: true
  timer: true,
bullets_container_class
Does the slider have a timer visible. Default: true
next_on_click: false,
next_on_click
Default: false
  variable_height: false,
variable_height
Does the slider have variable height images? Default: false
  before_slide_change: function() {}
before_slide_change
Execute a function before the slide changes. Default: function() {}
  after_slide_changes: function() {}
after_slide_changes
Execute a function after the slide changes. Default: function() {}

Real World Example

Here's an example of a customized Orbit container.

JavaScript

$(document).foundation({
  orbit: {
    animation: 'slide',
    timer_speed: 1000,
    pause_on_hover: true,
    animation_speed: 500,
    navigation_arrows: true,
    bullets: false,
    next_on_click: true
  }
});

HTML

<ul data-orbit
    data-options="animation:slide;
                  animation_speed:1000;
                  pause_on_hover:true;
                  animation_speed:500;
                  navigation_arrows:true;
                  bullets:false;
                  next_on_click:true;">
</ul>

Events

You can bind to the following events in your code.

Events

Description


orbit:ready
event
Fires when the slider has loaded
orbit:before-slide-change
event
Fires before the slide changes
orbit:after-slide-change
event, orbit
Fires after a slide transition animation has finished. The orbit parameter contains slide_number and total_slides
orbit:after-slide-change
event
Fires after a slide transition animation has finished. The orbit parameter contains slide_number and total_slides
orbit:timer-started
event
Fires each time the timer is started/resumed
orbit:timer-stopped
event
Fires each time the timer is paused/stopped

Example

Here's an example of how you can bind to these events:

HTML

<ul id="featured1" data-orbit>
  ...
</ul>

You can then bind using the following markup:

$("#featured1").on("orbit:ready", function(event) {
  console.info("ready");
});
$("#featured1").on("orbit:before-slide-change", function(event) {
  console.info("before slide change");
});
$("#featured1").on("orbit:after-slide-change", function(event, orbit) {
  console.info("after slide change");
  console.info("slide " + orbit.slide_number + " of " + orbit.total_slides);
});
$("#featured1").on("orbit:timer-started", function(event, orbit) {
  console.info("timer started");
});
$("#featured1").on("orbit:timer-stopped", function(event, orbit) {
  console.info("timer stopped");
});

Sass Errors?

If the default "foundation" import was commented out, then make sure you import this file:

SCSS

@import "foundation/components/orbit";

Foundation

Foundation is made by ZURB, a product design company in Campbell, California. We've put more than 15 years of experience building web products, services and websites into this framework.
